tasks: Doc sync: align README/CONTRIBUTING/SECURITY/CHANGELOG with actual commands, paths, and filenames. Only edit docs; skip if no mismatch.
Metadata hygiene: fill repository/homepage/bugs/engines fields in package.json/pyproject/setup.cfg when missing. No dependency upgrades.
Test helper cleanup: remove duplicated helper/types/constants in tests by reusing existing modules. Touch tests only; avoid production code.
Micro-cleanup: remove dead comments, unused files, or redundant config entries. Keep the change tiny (<=3 files, <=150 lines).
idle.promptTemplate:
You are running an autonomous idle task.
Target repo: {{repo}}
Task: {{task}}

Requirements:
- Follow AGENTS.md rules.
- Do not push directly to main/master. Use a branch, open a PR, post a summary comment that mentions @metyatech, then merge and close the PR if there are changes.
- If there are no safe changes, exit cleanly without opening a PR or reporting.
- If the repo has uncommitted changes, exit without making changes.
- Do not run lint/test/build just for a health check. Only run the smallest required checks when you actually change code.
- Prefer docs/config/test-only changes; avoid dependency upgrades.
- Keep changes small: at most 3 files and ~150 lines. Skip anything larger.
- Repository creation, splitting, renaming, archiving, or deletion is allowed only when clearly justified; otherwise avoid repo-level changes.
- At the end, output a summary block delimited by:
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_START
<summary>
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_END
Include: changes made, tests run (or 'Not run'), and commit hashes.

codex.promptTemplate:
You are running an autonomous task. Follow AGENTS.md rules. Use repo(s): {{repos}}. Task:
{{task}}

Requirements:
- GitHub operations (issues, PRs, commits, pushes) are allowed and are NOT considered external sending.
- Do not send or post anything outside GitHub (email, LMS, Slack, web forms, etc.) unless the user explicitly approves in the issue. If external communication is required, prepare a draft message + attachments list + checklist and ask the user for explicit approval before any send/post.
- Commit and push any code changes.
- Reference the issue number in commit messages (e.g., 'Refs #<issue-number>').
- At the end, output a summary block delimited by:
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_START
<summary>
AGENT_RUNNER_SUMMARY_END
Include: changes made, tests run (or 'Not run'), and commit hashes.
